headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.description: Report type. Enum values: AD to-be-deprecated : A report that provides in-seconds performance data on ads. VIDEO : A Video Insights report on a video. Default value: AD . Note : The enum value AD will be deprecated in the next API version. We recommend that you use VIDEO instead.

parameters.name: metrics_fields
parameters.description: Metrics that you want to get. By default, all metrics supported for the report_type that you specify will be returned. See the Supported metrics section for supported metrics.

parameters.name: filtering
parameters.description: Filtering conditions. When report_type is set to AD or not passed, you need to specify ad_ids , adgroup_ids , or campaign_ids . When report_type is set to VIDEO , you need to specify either material_ids or video_ids .

parameters.name: ad_ids Conditional
parameters.description: When report_type is set to AD or not passed, you need to specify ad_ids , adgroup_ids , or campaign_ids . IDs of the ads that you want to get in-second performance data for. Note : Currently, the limit of the ad_ids you pass is 200.

parameters.name: adgroup_ids Conditional
parameters.description: When report_type is set to AD or not passed, you need to specify ad_ids , adgroup_ids , or campaign_ids . IDs of the ad groups that you want to get in-second performance data for.

parameters.name: campaign_ids Conditional
parameters.description: When report_type is set to AD or not passed, you need to specify ad_ids , adgroup_ids , or campaign_ids . IDs of the campaigns that you want to get in-second performance data for.

parameters.name: material_ids Conditional
parameters.description: When report_type is set to VIDEO , you need to specify either material_ids or video_ids . Material IDs of the videos that you want to get Video Insights data on. Max size: 1.

parameters.name: video_ids Conditional
parameters.description: When report_type is set to VIDEO , you need to specify either material_ids or video_ids . IDs of the videos that you want to get Video Insights data on. Max size: 1.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Valid only when report_type is set to VIDEO . If you want to specify a time range for Video Insights data, you need to pass in both start_time and end_time , and specify lifetime as false . Query start time (closed interval) in the format of YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss (UTC+0 Time).

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Valid only when report_type is set to VIDEO . If you want to specify a time range for Video Insights data, you need to pass in both start_time and end_time , and specify lifetime as false . Query end time (closed interval) in the format of YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss (UTC+0 Time).

parameters.name: lifetime
parameters.description: Valid only when report_type is set to VIDEO . If you want to specify a time range for Video Insights data, you need to pass in both start_time and end_time , and specify lifetime as false . Whether to request lifetime data for metrics. Default value: true .

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Field to sort by. By default, results will be sorted by CREATE_TIME .

parameters.name: sort_type
parameters.description: Sorting type. Enum values: ASC (starting from the one that was created earliest), DES (starting from the one that was created latest).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size. Value range: 1-500. Default value: 10.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of error codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

fields.name: info
fields.description: Information about the subject to get benchmark data for.

fields.name: metric_name
fields.description: Metric name and the sequential in-seconds values. For instance, "share_count": [0, 0, 0, 1] means the ad receives 0 shares in the first two seconds, and one share in the third second. Note the first value is for the 0th second. See the Supported metrics section for the supported metrics.
